metadata.name: Ceremony #8
metadata.description:
This series celebrates fxhash turning one. #fxhashturnsone

I‚Äôm so grateful for this place and have ho idea how to adequately articulate how much this platform has changed my life, but it has. A million thanks to the team. You are so appreciated as are the artists and collectors that have made this such a beautiful community. ü•Ç

Definitely check out ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode by tapping ‚ÄúF‚Äù or mouse click/tap ‚Äî it will animate (you guessed it) forever and will change its layout every 365 frames, in honor of this wonderful year, and every year after. Some forever modes will ‚Äúnever forget‚Äù and others will fade as they progress. No idea if that‚Äôs a metaphor but it is a trait, that much I know.

All primary sales are donated to Code/Art, which is a charity that uses ‚Äú‚Ä¶Art to Inspire Girls in Computer Science.‚Äù Read about Code/Art here: https://www.code-art.com/

Ceremony uses public domain art (which is the original, more implicit version CC0) made exclusively by women.

See fxtext article linked from the project page for a gallery of the source material and other notes.

Ceremony is also CC0, so feel free use anything here in other projects.

You can read more about CC0 here:
https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/

F : ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode (tap after initial render completes)
P : Pause/Play
(mouse click/tap also works to start ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode or Pause/Play)

A : Add Grain (only works when paused in ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode.)
G : Toggle Grain (resets the whole piece)
M : Toggle Matte (resets the whole piece)

S : Save Image
1 -> 6 : Set pixel density (resets the whole piece)
(Default pixel density is 1 @ 2000x2000)

If you want to start in "Forever" mode, you can append "&forever=true" to the url in the live view.
You can also add pixel density to the url by appending ‚Äú&density=2‚Äù (or 3, 4, etc) to have it render at higher resolutions by default.

metadata.name: fx(mash) #167
metadata.description:
fx(mash) is my humble contribution to celebrating #fxhashturnsone

This series is based on a simple algorithm - lines of a random length are drawn on a square grid until the grid is full.

I have added a variety of features based on some of my favorite fxhash projects and a few special guests.

This collection is intentionally diverse and disorderly, that's a nice way of saying I only had a short period of time following the release of Acequia. As a result, some of the outputs might be weird, messy, or even bordering on broken (if you get one of the latter please let me know and I'll reimburse you).

Despite being a bit rough around the edges, I hope fx(mash) reflects some measure of my love for the fxhash community. If you're feeling kind, then perhaps it even harks back to the experimental early days :)

The last year has been an incredible journey, thank you for letting me be a part of our story so far.

Controls (in live view):

- Press [s] to save the current image
- Press [g] to toggle grain
- Press [h] for a high-res output

Beta Controls (in live view, definitely not fully tested):

- Press [p] to start/pause animation
- Press [i] to slow down animation
- Press [o] to speed up animation

All primary sales go to Savepakistan.


Acknowledgements:

fx(mash) uses Gorilla Sun's grain implementation, a big thanks to him and meezwhite for a great article that is well worth supporting https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/all-about-that-grain

Thank you to the artists who created the following collections. Some were the source for palettes, others directly inspired traits, and some I thought would be fun to include as specific trait values.

metadata.name: Annum #7743
metadata.description:
This project is being released in celebration of the 1 year aniversary of Achromat, my first release on fxhash. In addition to being inspired by Achromat, aspects of other previous projects have been incorporated. My deepest gratitude to all who have collected my work over the past year.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

50% of primary sales go to Savepakistan.

metadata.name: Open Space #101
metadata.description:
In celebration of #fxhashturnsone. 
Half of primary proceeds will be donated to @ProcessingOrg.

Press 's' to save a 2000x2000 image.
In fullscreen, add '&resolution=2' to the end of the URL to render @2x. 
Use 3,4 or 5 for resolutions up to 10000x10000.

Generation can take longer on older or lower-performance machines.
Artwork by 3dmanatee @3d_manatee. Made with p5js and ‚ù§Ô∏è. Made possible by fxhash and the fxhash community. Happy Birthday!

metadata.name: Simbol Rebirth  #15
metadata.description:
Simbol is reborn !

After a couple improvements the digital representation of a tree slice is back. This version is an update of Simbol my previous piece, with some fixes. 

 It is built around 3 elements that mimic real tree features: 

- Tree lines: they represent the age of the tree and may be more or less distorted depending on the tree. Lines can vary in color and opacity. Some lines have a chance to be rendered with dots.
- Knots: They are points of disruption present along some of the lines. They will push and pull the tree line around them and provide more movement to the piece.-
- Bark: It‚Äôs a frame of thousands of little circle that will coat the outside of a piece and provide a different set of texture and contrast with the smooth lines.

Features : 6 

@Fabax 01/22

attributes.name: Art #10
attributes.value: Hilma af Klint, Childhood Group IV, 1907

metadata.name: (un)connected #65
metadata.description:
A playful collection for #fxhashturnsone.

(un)connected
the older we get,
the more we risk losing the connection,
with who we once were,
what we still are,
colorful,
loving and caring,
playful,
connected

be
childlike


Thank you very much for this amazing first year. 


Controls:

- Press [p] to save the current image
- Press [1-5] to render and save the image in a higher resolution (1 = low; 5 = high)

Made with p5. All primary sales go to Savepakistan. Royalties go to the Processing Foundation.

Tested with Safari Version 16.1 (18614.2.9.1.12) and Chrome Version 107.0.5304.87. Browser updates can affect the future behavior.

metadata.name: New Wave #58
metadata.description:
100% of sales goes to Savepakistan Tezos Flood Relief Fundraiser. (https://hencommunity.quest/blog/savepakistan-announcement)

"Wave" was my first generator released on this platform a year ago and this celebrates #fxhashturnsone with a complete rework of this shader with different shapes and patterns.

Code: https://github.com/gre/gre/tree/master/doodles/new-wave

@greweb ‚Äì 2022 ‚Äì tech: WebGL ‚Äì CC BY-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/

metadata.name: Wondering #32
metadata.description:
The work contains a fluid simulation. I put random forces into the simulation and let it run 500 steps to create a flow field and then use it to generate the visuals. 

I choose fluid simulation instead of curl noise or any other noise function because I believe the fluid simulation could generate a movement that's more dynamic and organic. The result is a combination of big and small vortices.


This piece requires WebGL2 to run, please check and make sure this runs on your device in advance. Also you can press the spacebar to toggle the camera control.

metadata.name: Dragons #135
metadata.description:
A grid of many lines forming a dragon crafted on paper.
They all have their own personality... Be sure to name and take care of them.

tw: williamapan
